section-body.paragraph-text: Carcass or bead reinforcements are only classified in groups B60C9/00 and B60C15/00 respectively.
Sidewall reinforcing inserts for run-flat use are classified in group B60C17/00 only.

definition-item.definition-title: {Decorating, marking or the like}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the tyre sidewall is provided with decorative markings, patterns or lettering.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {Protection against exterior elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Elements in the side wall which increase the resistance to cutting or cracking.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 shows embedded pucture prevention layer within the sidewall of the tyre.
Figure 2 shows weather resistant coating provided to the tyre outer surface.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by sidewall curvature}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Tyres characterised by the curvature of the sidewall, e.g. radius of curvature.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows a tyre having a sidewall with specified curvature (i.e. KR2).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Carcass ply curvature

definition-item.definition-title: {built-up by narrow strip winding}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising additional bead cores in the sidewall}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein additional bead cores are provided in the sidewall portion of the tyre.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows bead cores used in a tyre sidewall.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyre characterised by multiple bead cores in the bead portion of the tyre

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangement of grooves or ribs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the sidewall comprises raised projections or recessed portions.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sidewall characterised by decorative features
Sidewall rubber inserts for run-flat purposes comprising grooves or ribs

definition-item.definition-title: {preventing watersplash}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the sidewall comprises structure for preventing the tyre from splashing mud or water.

definition-item.definition-title: {provided at the interior side only}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein grooves or projections are provided on the interior surface of the tyre sidewall.

definition-item.definition-title: having annular inlays or covers, e.g. white sidewalls

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the sidewall structure comprises a filled section or an applique of material in a colour other than black or a protective coating layer.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows a tyre with annular white sidewall veneer (44) covering the lower portion of black sidewall (40).

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising different sidewall rubber layers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the side wall is made of different rubber layers.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows a tyre with sidewall rubber layers (10) and (11).

definition-item.definition-title: Tyre beads, e.g. ply turn-up or overlap

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter that includes the structure of the annular edge of a pneumatic tyre that opens at the rim zone and includes annular reinforcing elements to anchor the tyre or the tyre carcass material to the rim.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Transverse section of the rim
Rims characterised by the form of tyre-seat or flange

section-body.paragraph-text: Carcass reinforcements per se are classified under B60C9/00.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: tyre beads
the annular edges of the tyre
bead cores or bead wires
the annular reinforcing elements of the beads

definition-item.definition-title: {features of the carcass terminal portion}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the tyre is characterised by the carcass ply terminal portion, e.g. the shape of the terminal portion, the terminating location of the carcass ply turn-up, or the manner in which the carcass ply folds around or interfaces with annular reinforcing elements in the bead.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows carcass terminal portion (6b) having end (6e).

definition-item.definition-title: {not folded around the bead core, e.g. floating or down ply}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the bead portion of the tyre includes annular reinforcing elements to anchor the tyre or the tyre carcass layers, wherein the carcass layers terminate within the bead portion without being folded around any annular reinforcing element.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {with low ply turn-up, i.e. folded around the bead core and terminating at the bead core}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply folds around and terminates at an annular reinforcing element.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {with high ply turn-up, i.e. folded around the bead core and terminating radially above the point of maximum section width}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply folds around an annular reinforcing element and a terminal end of said ply extends radially outwards of the maximum section width of the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: {with ply turn-up up to the belt edges, i.e. folded around the bead core and extending to the belt edges}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply folds around an annular reinforcing element and a terminal end of said ply extends at least as far as the edge of a belt reinforcing layer.

definition-item.definition-title: {with ply turn-up portion parallel and adjacent to carcass main portion}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply folds around an annular reinforcing element and a terminal end of said ply extends parallel and adjacent to the carcass main portion.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {with ply turn-up portion diverging from carcass main portion}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply folds around an annular reinforcing element and the terminal ends of said ply diverge from the carcass main portion.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {with ply reverse folding, i.e. carcass layer folded around the bead core from the outside to the inside}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the carcass plies are turned about an annular reinforcing element in a direction from the axial outer wall of the bead portion of the tyre to the inner wall of the bead portion of the tyre. This direction is the reverse of the more conventional disposition of carcass plies about the annular reinforcing elements.

definition-item.definition-title: {the carcass plies folded around or between more than one bead core}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass plies are folded around or between multiple annular reinforcing elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyre bead containing multiple bead cores

definition-item.definition-title: {Height of the carcass terminal portion defined in terms of a numerical value or ratio in proportion to section height}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the carcass ply turned about the annular reinforcing element is of such length as to extend along the side portion of the carcass a specified absolute extent or an extent that is relative to other tyre dimensions, e.g. the maximum height of the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: Seating or securing beads on rims (sealing means between beads and rims of tubeless tyres B60C5/16; means for securing solid tyres on rims B60C7/24)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter whereby resilient tyres are held secured to vehicle wheels or rims.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sealing means between beads and rims of tubeless tyres
Means for securing solid tyres on rims

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rims
Rims characterised by the form of tyre-seat or flange

definition-item.definition-title: {Supplementary means for securing the bead}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the rim or tyre bead comprises additional means engageable with a corresponding tyre bead or rim to secure the tyre to a bead flange on the rim.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rim comprising appurtenances, e.g. lining bands

definition-item.definition-title: {the bead being secured by bead extensions which extend over and wrap around the rim flange}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein supplementary means has projections that wrap around and engage with the rim flange.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {Securing tyres without beads; Securing closed torus or tubular tyres}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein a tyre without annular edges, i.e. without bead portions, is secured to a rim or wheel.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 shows closed torus tyre secured to a rim.
Figure 2 shows a tyre having radially inner ends secured to the rim by being sandwiched between rim parts.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyre having closed or toroidal transverse section

definition-item.definition-title: {Asymmetric bead seats, e.g. different bead diameter or inclination angle (asymmetric transverse section B60C3/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein a bead seat on one side of the tyre differs in diameter, inclination angle or shape from a bead seat on the other side of the tyre.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Asymmetric transverse section

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Asymmetric bead reinforcement

definition-item.definition-title: Bead contour, e.g. lips, grooves, or ribs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the hub or rim contacting portion of the tyre is characterised by the overall outer contour or by additional frictional enhancing means to ensure grip between rim contacting portion of the tyre and the rim.

definition-item.definition-title: {with bead extensions located radially outside the rim flange position, e.g. rim flange protectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead is characterised by projecting portions or extensions in the region radially outside the rim flange contact portion of the bead, e.g. rim flange protectors.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows extension being radially outside the rim flange.

definition-item.definition-title: {Bead lips at the bead toe portion, i.e. the axially and radially inner end of the bead}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead is characterised by the bead contour of the axially and radially inner end of the bead.

definition-item.definition-title: {with reverse bead seat inclination, i.e. the axially inner diameter of the bead seat is bigger than the axially outer diameter thereof}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the bead is seated such that the axially inner diameter of the bead seat is greater than the axially outer diameter thereof. This arrangement is the reverse of the more conventional disposition of a bead seat.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: Spacers between beads (emergency load-supporting means B60C17/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein interior spacers, clamps or spreaders act laterally or laterally and downwardly to clamp adjacent portions of the tyre against flanges on the rim.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Emergency load-supporting means

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rim comprising bead clamping elements

definition-item.definition-title: inflatable

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: Bead cores

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead portion of the tyre is characterised by the annular reinforcing element, e.g. size, shape or material thereof.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows a bead core structure.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Producing bead-rings or bead-cores for tyres

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the material of the core, e.g. alloy}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead is characterised by the material of the annular reinforcing element.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by a wrapping layer}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein annular reinforcing element is encased in or wrapped by a layer.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcement layers folded around bead core, i.e. flipper

definition-item.definition-title: {Polygonal cores characterised by the winding sequence}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead core is formed by annular winding of a reinforcing element wherein the winding structure or sequence is specified.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: multiple, i.e. with two or more cores in each bead

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the rim contacting portion of the tyre contains two or more annular reinforcing elements.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyre sidewalls comprising additional bead cores
Carcass plies folded around or between multiple bead cores

definition-item.definition-title: Flipper strips, fillers, or chafing strips {and reinforcing layers for the construction of the bead}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead is characterised by reinforcing or elastomeric cushion layers other than the carcass ply and the annular reinforcing element.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows a tyre bead portion showing terminology and position of commonly used cushion and reinforcement layers.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by features of the bead filler or apex}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the bead is provided with a wedge shaped or triangular insert that is generally disposed radially above the bead core in such a way the carcass ply is wound around the bead core so that the turned-up portion of the carcass ply is separated from the main carcass portion by the wedge shaped or triangular insert.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions of the apex rubber

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising several parts, e.g. made of different rubbers}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead filler or bead apex is characterised by multiple parts or layers.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bead cores comprise additional cushion rubber layers, including adjacent to the carcass ply turn-up portion

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Dimensions of the bead filler in terms of numerical values or ratio in proportion to section height}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the dimensions of the bead filler are specified in terms of an absolute extent or an extent that is relative to other tyre dimensions, e.g. the maximum height of the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by features of the chafer or clinch portion, i.e. the part of the bead contacting the rim}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead portion is characterised by the portion of the bead intended to come into direct contact with the rim, i.e. chafer.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: chafer
bead portion of the tyre that makes direct contact with the rim

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising a cushion rubber other than the chafer or clinch rubber}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead portion is characterised by additional elastomeric cushion layers other than the bead filler and rim contacting layer.

definition-item.definition-title: {adjacent to the carcass turnup portion}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the additional cushion layer is adjacent the turn-up portion, generally on the side of the turn-up portion opposite the bead filler.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {provided at the terminal edge portion of a carcass or reinforcing layer}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein there is an additional cushion layer provided at the terminal end of the carcass ply turn up portion or an additional reinforcing layer, e.g. a chipper.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising a bead reinforcing layer}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the bead portion is characterised by a cord reinforced elastomeric layer other than the carcass ply and the bead anchoring reinforcing element.

definition-item.definition-title: {using flippers in contact with and wrapped around the bead core and, at least partially, in contact with the bead filler}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the bead portion is characterised by a cord reinforced layer folded directly around the bead anchoring reinforcing element and between the bead anchoring reinforcing element and the carcass material, such layer is generally referred to as a flipper.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {using chippers between the carcass layer and chafer rubber wrapped around the bead}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein bead portion is characterised by a cord reinforced layer wrapped around the bead core and between the carcass material and the rim contacting layer, i.e. chipper.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: chafer
bead portion of the tyre that makes direct contact with the rim
chipper
a cord reinforced layer wrapped around the bead core and between the carcass material and the rim contacting layer

definition-item.definition-title: {Asymmetric bead reinforcement, e.g. arrangement of bead reinforcing layer or apex}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the arrangement or structure of reinforcement, filler or cushion layers in one bead portion is different from that of the opposing bead portion.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Asymmetric transverse section of tyre
Asymmetric bead seats

definition-item.definition-title: Tyres characterised by means enabling restricted operation in damaged or deflated condition; Accessories therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the pneumatic tyre or inner tube is provided with means that permit the resultant assembly to continue operation when the inflation pressure in the pneumatic tyre or inner tube drops substantially below normal or when the pneumatic tyre or inner tube is punctured or otherwise damaged.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyres having multiple separate inflatable chambers
Tyres having additional shear belt layers
Puncture preventing arrangements and sealant layers
Repairing of plastic articles, e.g. tyres
Auto-repairing devices or arrangements, e.g. by introducing sealing compositions into the tyre
Incorporating auto-repairing or self-sealing arrangements into tyres

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising sidewall rubber inserts, e.g. crescent shaped inserts}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the structural stiffness of a pneumatic tyre sidewall is enhanced by a reinforcing insert that compensates for potential loss of pneumatic stiffness by deflation.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {two or more inserts in each sidewall portion}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising portions of different rubbers in a single insert}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows differently hashed portions for different rubbers.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising additional reinforcements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the sidewall reinforcing insert comprises additional reinforcing layers, e.g. a cord reinforced layer.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising grooves or ribs, e.g. at the inner side of the insert}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangement of grooves or ribs in the sidewall

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising special reinforcing means in the crown area}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the crown region of the tyre is provided with special reinforcing means to support the tyre structure in the deflated condition.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
The regular structure or arrangements of belts or breaker, crown-reinforcing or cushioning layers should be classified in B60C9/18 – B60C9/30.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising annular protrusions projecting into the tyre cavity}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the tyre structure is provided with annular protrusions formed on or attached to the tyre in order to enable operation in the damaged or deflated condition.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tyres utilising non-inflatable supports that become load-supporting in an emergency

definition-item.definition-title: utilising additional inflatable supports which become load-supporting in emergency

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the additional means that permits the assembly to continue operations is a pneumatic member that is located in the chamber of the pneumatic tyre and supports the pneumatic tyre when the tyre is damaged or loses inflation pressure.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Inflatable inserts for pneumatic tyres
Tyres with multiple separate inflatable chambers
Inflatable bead spacers or spreaders

definition-item.definition-title: inflated or expanded in emergency only

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein an inflatable member carried in the tyre chamber is inflated to support the tyre in response to loss of air pressure.

definition-item.definition-title: utilising additional non-inflatable supports which become load-supporting in emergency

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the support means is distinct from the tyre and permits the tyre assembly to continue operation when its inflation pressure drops. The support means is an integral part of the tyre and is located within the tyre cavity.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:

definition-item.definition-title: Means facilitating folding of sidewalls, e.g. run-flat sidewalls

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the tyre includes sidewalls which are foldable on themselves at predetermined adjacent sidewall portions to sustain the tyre to permit continued operation of the tyre upon loss of inflation pressure during use.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows sidewall structure facilitating folding.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Means facilitating folding of sidewalls for storage purposes

definition-item.definition-title: Internal lubrication

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the support means that enables restricted operation of the tyre in a damaged or deflated condition comprises a lubricating or cooling composition which is disposed in the pneumatic tyre chamber.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows lubricant layer (20).

definition-item.definition-title: Tyre parts or constructions not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Constructional details or features related to:

list-item.paragraph-text: noise attenuating means integral with the tyre;
balancing means attached to the tyre;
tyre sensors other than pressure sensors;
electric charge dissipating means integral with the tyre;
puncture sealing means integral with the tyre.

residual-references.section-title: References out of a residual place

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places in relation to which this place is residual:

table-column.paragraph-text: Monitoring of tyre pressure
Non-skid devices
Auto-repairing devices or arrangements, e.g. by introducing sealing compositions into the tyre

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Simulation or design methods for tyres
Testing of tyres

definition-item.definition-title: {Tyres requiring an asymmetric or a special mounting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the tyre is characterised by the intended mounting position in relation to the vehicle, e.g. front vs. rear, inboard vs. outboard sides or camber angle.
Illustrative examples of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure 1 illustrates tyres configured for particular front and rear mounting positions.
Figure 2 illustrates a tyre configured for an intended camber angle.
Tyres characterised only by a directional tread having intended rotational direction should be classified under B60C11/0302.
Tyres characterised only by an asymmetric tread having intended mounting position in relation to vehicle (i.e. inboard and outboard sides) should be classified under B60C11/0304.

definition-item.definition-title: {Noise damping elements provided in the tyre structure or attached thereto, e.g. in the tyre interior}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein a noise damping or absorbing means is provided in or attached to the tyre structure.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure shows noise damping element attached to both the tyre and rim.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Attachment of a noise dampening member to the rim/wheel

definition-item.definition-title: {Balancing means attached to the tyre}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the tyre is provided with means integral therewith or permanently associated therewith or attached thereto for statically or dynamically balancing the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: {Tyre sensors other than for detecting tyre pressure}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sensors located in the tyre without specific disclosure related to what the sensor is particularly used for.
Sensors that specifically do not measure pressure or temperature.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Attachment of a pressure or temperature sensor to the tyre

definition-item.definition-title: {Venting means, e.g. for expelling entrapped air}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the tyre structure is provided with means for venting air that may become entrapped between layers during tyre manufacture, e.g. gas bleeder cords.

definition-item.definition-title: Tyre with openings closeable by means other than the rim; Closing means therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein means, other than a rim, close an opening in a tyre casing through which an inner tube may be inserted or close an opening in a tubeless tyre casing. The means may interlock with, attach to or form an integral part of the tyre casing.

definition-item.definition-title: Electric-charge-dissipating arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein means are provided integral or permanently associated with the resilient tyre in order to conduct an electrical current in, on or through the resilient tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: {comprising a conductive tread insert}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein an electrically conductive means is provided in the tread portion.

definition-item.definition-title: {using conductive carcasses}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the carcass ply is electrically conductive, e.g. conductive reinforcing element or ply coat.

definition-item.definition-title: {using conductive sidewalls}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein an electrically conductive means is provided in the sidewall.

definition-item.definition-title: {using conductive beads}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein an electrically conductive means is provided in the bead portion of the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: Puncture preventing arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Subject matter wherein the pneumatic tyre or inner tube is provided with a self-healing feature to seal breaks made in the pneumatic tyre or inner tube, e.g. a sealant layer or a puncture-resistant feature to prevent breaks in the pneumatic tyre or inner tube, e.g. armour layer.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this place:
Figure above shows a tyre having an armour layer (1) for preventing puncture.
Figure shows a tyre having a sealant layer (14).

table-column.paragraph-text: Sealing compositions per se
Devices for introducing sealing compositions into the tyre

definition-item.definition-title: {disposed inside of the inner liner}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the puncture sealing or puncture preventing feature is disposed on the inner surface of the tyre.

definition-item.definition-title: {disposed removably on the tyre}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the puncture sealing or puncture preventing feature is removable.

definition-item.definition-title: {for inner tubes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Subject matter wherein the puncture sealing or puncture preventing feature is configured for an inner tube.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices that are adapted for mounting on vehicles and are operational while the vehicle is moving.
Automatically distributing tyre pressure.
Monitoring tyre pressure status:

list-item.paragraph-text: Directly by measuring tyre air pressure.

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus or tools adapted for mounting, removing or inspecting tyres (testing of tyres G01M17/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Hand-tools and machines for mounting or demounting a tyre on/from a rim portion.
Demounting machines also include separation of tyres from rims by destroying one or both parts.
